title: Hanging, 17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: plain weave foundation with 3-span floats of 2 continuous supplementary wefts bound by the foundation warp in plain weave alignment. The white silk supplementary weft patterns by moving from front to back. The metal suppleme
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 250 x 103 cm (8 ft. 2 7/16 in. x 40 9/16 in.)
description: Woven hanging or curtain with borders on four sides – a white pattern on an orange background. Field has vertically symmetrical flowering vine with peacock. Two borders above and below field: one a narrow inner border with detached blossoms, 6 cm high, both facing up; the other a wide band with a floral vine, 16.5 cm high, both facing out. Narrow floral vine outer border on all sides 6 cm wide.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, 17th century.
17th century. Medium: silk, metal
Technique: plain weave foundation with 3-span floats of 2 continuous supplementary wefts bound by the foundation warp in plain weave alignment. The white silk supplementary weft patterns by moving from front to back. The metal suppleme. Bequest of Erskine Hewitt. 1938-57-1260.
